title: Machine Learning Basics Quiz
description: Assess your understanding of machine learning basics.

questions.question: What is Machine Learning?

choices.choice: A type of artificial intelligence that allows software applications to become more accurate at predicting outcomes without being explicitly programmed to do so

questions.question: Which of the following is a popular Machine Learning algorithm?
What is supervised learning?

choices.choice: The machine is given the answer key and it learns to find the answer
The machine is given data without the answer key
The machine is not given any data

questions.question: What is a decision tree?

choices.choice: A flowchart-like tree structure where an internal node represents a feature (or attribute), the branch represents a decision rule, and each leaf node represents the outcome
A chart that shows the decisions made by the machine
A binary tree used in sorting algorithms

questions.question: What is overfitting?

choices.choice: When a model learns the training data too well and performs poorly on new, unseen data
When a model performs well on both training and test data
When a model performs poorly on both training and test data

questions.question: What is cross-validation?

choices.choice: A technique for assessing how the results of a statistical analysis will generalize to an independent data set
A technique for training machine learning models

title: Cybersecurity Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of cybersecurity basics.

questions.question: What is the purpose of cybersecurity?

choices.choice: To protect computer systems from theft or damage to their hardware, software, or data
To enhance the performance of computer systems

questions.question: What is a firewall?

choices.choice: A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules
A physical barrier to protect computer systems

questions.question: What is phishing?

choices.choice: A technique used to gain sensitive information, such as usernames, passwords, and credit card details, by masquerading as a trustworthy entity
A technique to improve the performance of computer systems
A technique to develop new software applications

questions.question: What is a virus?

choices.choice: A type of malware that replicates itself by modifying other computer programs and inserting its own code
A security measure to protect computer systems
A software application used for data analysis

questions.question: What is encryption?

choices.choice: A process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access
A process to enhance the performance of computer systems
A process to develop new software applications

title: Data Science Fundamentals Quiz

A field of study that focuses on hardware development

choices.choice: A method of data analysis that automates analytical model building

questions.question: What is a data pipeline?

choices.choice: A set of data processing elements connected in series, where the output of one element is the input of the next

questions.question: What is a data lake?

choices.choice: A system or repository of data stored in its natural/raw format, usually object blobs or files

questions.question: What is the purpose of data visualization?

choices.choice: To communicate information clearly and effectively through graphical means

choices.choice: The current remains the same in all components.

choices.choice: Power rating, size, weight, speed, and torque requirements

By asking astronauts on the spacecraft to report their position
By sending a rover to measure the distance

questions.question: What is one method used to communicate with spacecraft?

choices.choice: Sending signals via the spacecraft's antenna and receiving them with the DSN on Earth

questions.question: The Deep Space Network (DSN) consists of three large antennas located in Australia, the United States, and Spain.
It is common for missions to Mars to include astronauts on board.

title: Quiz - Use Of Telescopes In Space Study
description: Test your knowledge about telescopes used in space study.

questions.question: What is the primary difference between a ground telescope and a space telescope?

choices.choice: The location where they are used
The type of objects they can observe

questions.question: Why are space telescopes necessary?

choices.choice: To observe objects blocked by Earth's atmosphere
To provide a clearer view of distant objects
To avoid light pollution from cities

questions.question: The Hubble Space Telescope has contributed to the understanding of the formation of galaxies.
How do space telescopes contribute to scientific theories?

choices.choice: By providing evidence to support new theories

questions.question: The Very Large Telescope (VLT) is located in North America.
What is the main purpose of the James Webb Space Telescope?

choices.choice: To study the behavior of asteroids

questions.question: Space telescopes are necessary because Earth's atmosphere blocks some of the light waves.

title: Quiz - Future of Robotic Exploration
description: Test your knowledge about the future of robotic exploration in space.

questions.question: Why are space rovers preferred over sending astronauts to Mars?

choices.choice: Rovers are safer, more cost-effective, and can be sent more frequently than astronauts

questions.question: Space rovers explore Mars by taking images and sending them back to Earth for analysis.
What is one of the primary tasks of a space rover on Mars?
Space rovers are equipped with robotic arms to collect samples from the Martian surface.
The presence of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur is essential for the existence of life.
Space rovers use a combination of cameras and sensors to measure various environmental factors on Mars.
